means: 学习，研究( study的过去式和过去分词 )

sentence.Network_en: She studied him for the longest time, looking wryly amused.
sentence.Network_cn: 她面带苦笑，盯着他看了很长时间。

sentence.Network_en: Haley studied her, an enigmatic smile on his face.
sentence.Network_cn: 黑利打量着她，脸上带着神秘的笑容。

sentence.Network_en: Geologists have studied the way that heat flows from the earth.
sentence.Network_cn: 地质学家曾研究过热量如何散出地球。

entry.def: A studied action is deliberate or planned.

example.ex: 'We both have an interesting 10 days coming up,' said Alex Ferguson with studied understatement.
example.tran: 亚历克斯·弗格森故作轻描淡写地说：“我们都即将迎来愉快的 10 天。”

means.word_mean: 1. produced or marked by conscious design or premeditation;

sentences.sentence: "a note of biting irony and studied insult"- V.L.Parrington

means.word_mean: 2. carefully practiced or designed or premeditated;

Sentence.sentence: He studied the designs of various choices.
Before she went to Brazil, she studied Portuguese for three months.
Kao said she cautions against forming any generalizations based on any one of the studies, noting that more background characteristics of the students need to be studied and explained.
A chronicle professor, Henry Louis Gates, recently studied are search project looking into 19th century African-American fiction and poetry.
But Schweitzer contends the "mounting causal evidence" linking goal-setting and harmful behavior should be studied to help spotlight issues that merit caution and further investigation.
Russell Fazio, an Ohio State psychology professor who has studied interracial roommates there and at Indiana University, discovered an intriguing academic effect.
